results.title: Modulation of radiosensitivity of DU145 prostate carcinoma cells by simvastatin
results.text_hl: Modulation of radiosensitivity of @CELLLINE_CVCL:0105 @@@DU145@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate carcinoma@@@ cells by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits prostatic hyperplasia in rats with metabolic syndrome.
results.text_hl: Level of serum @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@, prostatic weight, @DISEASE_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D006965 @@@hyperplasia@@@ as well as expressions of @GENE_IL6 @GENE_24498 @@@IL-6@@@, @GENE_TNF @GENE_24835 @@@TNF-alpha@@@ and @GENE_IGF1 @GENE_24482 @@@IGF-1@@@ in the blank and saline subgroups of HFD group were higher than that of ND group (P < 0.05). While @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has significantly resisted the former effects of HFD on serum @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate@@@ (P < 0.05).

results.title: LDL cholesterol promotes the proliferation of prostate and pancreatic cancer cells by activating the STAT3 pathway.
results.text_hl: However, deletion of LDL-activated @GENE_STAT3 @GENE_6774 @@@STAT3@@@ in @CELLLINE_CVCL:0395 @@@LNCaP@@@ and @CELLLINE_CVCL:0480 @@@PANC-1@@@ cells and reduced LDL-induced cell viability. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SV@@@) treatment also alleviated LDL-induced cell viability and migration ability in both the @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate and pancreatic tumor@@@ cells.

results.text_hl: Suppression of interactions between @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumor@@@ cell-surface integrin and endothelial @GENE_ICAM1 @GENE_3383 @@@ICAM-1@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibits micrometastasis.

results.title: Effects of simvastatin, acetylsalicylic acid, and rosiglitazone on proliferation of normal and cancerous prostate epithelial cells at therapeutic concentrations.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@acetylsalicylic acid@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@ on proliferation of normal and cancerous @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate@@@ epithelial cells at therapeutic concentrations.

results.title: Evidence for Feedback Regulation Following Cholesterol Lowering Therapy in a Prostate Cancer Xenograft Model.
results.text_hl: Tumoral RNA was extracted and cDNA synthesized from 1 ug of total RNA for quantitative real-time PCR. RESULTS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ directly reduced in vitro @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate@@@ cell proliferation in a dose-dependent, cell line-specific manner, but @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ had no effect.

citations.NLM: Masko EM, Alfaqih MA, Solomon KR, Barry WT, Newgard CB, Muehlbauer MJ, Valilis NA, Phillips TE, Poulton SH, Freedland AR, Sun S, Dambal SK, Sanders SE, Macias E, Freeman MR, Dewhirst MW, Pizzo SV, Freedland SJ. Evidence for Feedback Regulation Following Cholesterol Lowering Therapy in a Prostate Cancer Xenograft Model. Prostate. 2017 Apr;77(5):446-457. PMID: 27900797

results.title: Synergistic simvastatin and metformin combination chemotherapy for osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.
results.text_hl: Studies of @CELLLINE_CVCL:4787 @@@C4-2B4@@@ orthotopic NCr-nu/nu @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ further demonstrated that combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (3.5-7.0 mug/g body weight @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and 175-350 mug/g body weight @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@) daily by oral gavage over a 9-week period significantly inhibited primary ventral @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumor@@@ formation, @DISEASE_Cachexia @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@, @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@bone metastasis@@@, and biochemical failure more effectively than 24 mug/g body weight @CHEMICAL_Docetaxel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077143 @@@docetaxel@@@ intraperitoneally injected every 3 weeks, 7.0 mug/g/day @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, or 350 mug/g/day @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment alone, with significantly less @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@ and mortality than @CHEMICAL_Docetaxel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077143 @@@docetaxel@@@, establishing combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a promising chemotherapeutic alternative for metastatic @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms_Castration_Resistant @DISEASE_MESH:D064129 @@@CRPC@@@.

citations.NLM: Babcook MA, Shukla S, Fu P, Vazquez EJ, Puchowicz MA, Molter JP, Oak CZ, MacLennan GT, Flask CA, Lindner DJ, Parker Y, Daneshgari F, Gupta S. Synergistic simvastatin and metformin combination chemotherapy for osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. Mol Cancer Ther. 2014 Oct;13(10):2288-302. PMID: 25122066

results.title: Anticancer efficacy of simvastatin on prostate cancer cells and tumor xenografts is associated with inhibition of Akt and reduced prostate-specific antigen expression.
results.text_hl: Our findings demonstrate the therapeutic benefits of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D011471 @@@prostate cancer@@@ and suggest a link between @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, regulation of @GENE_AKT1 @GENE_207 @@@Akt@@@ activity, and @GENE_KLK3 @GENE_354 @@@PSA@@@ expression in @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumors@@@.

citations.NLM: Kochuparambil ST, Al-Husein B, Goc A, Soliman S, Somanath PR. results.title: Enhanced antitumor effects of low-frequency ultrasound and microbubbles in combination with simvastatin by downregulating caveolin-1 in prostatic DU145 cells
results.text_hl: Low-frequency ultrasound (LFU) has potential clinical applications in the treatment of @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D011471 @@@prostate cancer@@@ due to its strong penetrability and high sensitivity towards @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ cells. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ has often been administered as a preventive agent in @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumors@@@.

citations.NLM: Xu WP, Shen E, Bai WK, Wang Y, Hu B. Enhanced antitumor effects of low-frequency ultrasound and microbubbles in combination with simvastatin by downregulating caveolin-1 in prostatic DU145 cells Oncol Lett. 2014 Jun;7(6):2142-2148. PMID: 24932304

results.title: Combination simvastatin and metformin induces G1-phase cell cycle arrest and Ripk1- and Ripk3-dependent necrosis in C4-2B osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer cells
results.text_hl: We previously demonstrated that combination @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@) and @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@MET@@@) ameliorates critical Warburg effect-related metabolic aberrations of @CELLLINE_CVCL:4784 @@@C4-2B@@@ cells, synergistically and significantly decreases @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms_Castration_Resistant @DISEASE_MESH:D064129 @@@CRPC@@@ cell viability and metastatic properties, with minimal effect on normal prostate epithelial cells, and inhibits primary @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumor@@@ growth, @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@metastasis@@@, and biochemical failure in an orthotopic model of metastatic @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms_Castration_Resistant @DISEASE_MESH:D064129 @@@CRPC@@@, more effectively than @CHEMICAL_Docetaxel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077143 @@@docetaxel@@@ chemotherapy.

citations.NLM: Babcook MA, Sramkoski RM, Fujioka H, Daneshgari F, Almasan A, Shukla S, Nanavaty RR, Gupta S. Combination simvastatin and metformin induces G1-phase cell cycle arrest and Ripk1- and Ripk3-dependent necrosis in C4-2B osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer cells Cell Death Dis. 2014 Nov 20;5(11):e1536. PMID: 25412314
